metadata.title: CVE-2019-10092 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.description:
In Apache HTTP Server 2.4.0-2.4.39, a limited cross-site scripting issuewas reported affecting the mod_proxy error page. An attacker could causethe link on the error page to be malformed and instead point to a page oftheir choice. This would only be exploitable where a server was set up withproxying enabled but was misconfigured in such a way that the Proxy Errorpage was displayed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10092` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.41-1ubuntu1
apache2-bin - 2.4.41-1ubuntu1
apache2-data - 2.4.41-1ubuntu1
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.41-1ubuntu1
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.41-1ubuntu1
apache2-utils - 2.4.41-1ubuntu1
libapache2-mod-md - 2.4.41-1ubuntu1
libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.4.41-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.41-1ubuntu1').
